subject: RE: [junit] JUnit and Java 1.4
msgSnippet: JUnit 3.7 deprecated assert() in favor of assertTrue() for the reason mentioned below.  But users also have to know to use assertTrue() where they would
messageBody:
JUnit 3.7 deprecated assert() in favor of assertTrue() for the reason
mentioned below. But users also have to know to use assertTrue() where they
would previously have used assert() if they are using the 1.4 JDK.

Scott Stirling
JRun QA
Macromedia

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jason.rogers@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2001 5:39 PM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit and Java 1.4
>
>
> There is a new release coming out (maybe is out already) that
> compensates
> for this.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: ehusby@... [mailto:ehusby@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2001 5:36 PM
> > To: Junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] JUnit and Java 1.4
> >
> >
> > As an experiment, knowning that Java 1.4 now has support
> > for assertions, I
> > decided to try compiling a program
> > with the latest beta release.
> >
> > All my unit test code got flagged with warnings stating
> > "as of release 1.4,
> > assert is a keyword, and may not be used as an identifier."
> >
> > Does anyone know what the Junit plans are in this regard?
